name: Overlook Development Co. v. Public Service Commission et al., Appellants
name_abbreviation: Overlook Development Co. v. Public Service Commission

judges: Before Frazer, C. J., Walling, Simpson, Kephart, Schaffer, Maxey and Drew, JJ.
parties: Overlook Development Co. v. Public Service Commission et al., Appellants.

opinions.text:
Per Curiam,
The decision of the Superior Court reversing the order of the public service commission in this case, is affirmed on the opinion of the learned judge of that court, which sets forth clearly the facts and the correct conclusions of law applicable thereto.
opinions.author: Per Curiam,

attorneys: Lyman G. Windolph, of Windolph £ Mueller, for appellant.
John Fox Weiss, with him Daniel S. Kunlcel and E. Everett Mather, Jr., for public service commission.
Charles G. Balcer, with him Zimmerman, Myers & Kready, for appellee.
casebody.head_matter:
Overlook Development Co. v. Public Service Commission et al., Appellants.
Argued November 25, 1931.
Before Frazer, C. J., Walling, Simpson, Kephart, Schaffer, Maxey and Drew, JJ.
Lyman G. Windolph, of Windolph £ Mueller, for appellant.
January 5, 1932:
John Fox Weiss, with him Daniel S. Kunlcel and E. Everett Mather, Jr., for public service commission.
Charles G. Balcer, with him Zimmerman, Myers & Kready, for appellee.
